title: Artist Leaderboard light-blue background theme update

requirements.summary: Switch the Artist Leaderboard page background from dark/coffee-toned to a light blue using the existing CSS variable theme approach so body and mandala-bg match.
acceptanceCriteria: When viewing the Artist Leaderboard page, the primary page background renders as a light blue color.
The background color change is applied via the existing theme/CSS variable approach (so it affects the `mandala-bg` container and the `body` background consistently).

file_operations.description: Stop forcing the app into dark mode via a persistent `dark` class so the updated light theme variables can drive the page background consistently (including the body background).

Update the existing theme CSS variables (notably `--background`, and any closely coupled surface tokens like `--card`/`--popover`) to a light-blue base so both `body` (bg-background) and `.mandala-bg` (uses `--background`) render with the new light blue background.

requirements.summary: Adjust styling to preserve readability and visual separation on the new light-blue background, keeping overlays subtle and cards/rows contrasted.
acceptanceCriteria: All page text (header, subheader, footer, and leaderboard row content) maintains sufficient contrast against the new light blue background.
The mandala pattern and paper texture overlays remain subtle and do not reduce readability on the light blue background.
Glassmorphism cards/rows remain visually separated from the light blue background (no washed-out blending).

file_operations.description: Tune contrast-related theme variables (e.g., `--foreground`, `--muted-foreground`, `--border`, `--card`) for the light-blue background, and adjust `.mandala-bg::before` / `.mandala-bg::after` overlay opacity and blending so the mandala and paper textures remain subtle and do not harm readability; keep the approach within the existing CSS variable + utility structure.

Review and adjust page-level text and border utility classes (e.g., header/footer text colors and divider border opacity) as needed to ensure consistent contrast on the new light-blue background without introducing new routes or altering leaderboard behavior.
Adjust header label styling (including any dark-mode-specific classes that may no longer apply) so column labels remain readable and visually consistent with the new light-blue background.
